environmental_biodegradations.References: SEKIGUCHI H ET AL; BIODEGRADATION OF SOME ANIONIC SURFACTANTS IN RIVER AND SEA WATERS; YUKAGAKU 24(7) 451 (1975)
environmental_biodegradations.Value: BIODEGRADABILITY OF ANIONIC SURFACTANTS IN RIVER DIE-AWAY TEST WAS EVALUATED BY METHYLENE BLUE ACTIVITY & BY TOTAL ORGANIC CARBON. SODIUM POLYOXYETHYLENE GLYCOL N-DODECYL ETHER SULFATE WAS USED AND WAS BIODEGRADED INTO INORGANIC SUBSTANCES.

non_human_toxicity_excerpts.References: Gosselin, R.E., H.C. Hodge, R.P. Smith, and M.N. Gleason. Clinical Toxicology of Commercial Products. 4th ed. Baltimore: Williams and Wilkins, 1976., p. II-178
non_human_toxicity_excerpts.Value: TAKEN BY MOUTH, SODIUM LAURYL SULFATE STIMULATES GASTRIC MUCOUS PRODUCTION & SOMETIMES INACTIVATES PEPSIN IN TEST ANIMALS. /SODIUM LAURYL SULFATE/
SODIUM POLYOXYETHYLENE LAURYL SULFATES THAT POSSESS SHORTER CHAINS OF HYDROPHILIC GROUP PRODUCED MORE IRRITATING ACTIONS ON SKIN OF GUINEA PIGS & RABBITS THAN THOSE WITH LONGER CHAINS.

non_human_toxicity_excerpts.References: PROTTEY C, FERGUSON T; J SOC COSMET CHEM 26(JAN) 29 (1975)
non_human_toxicity_excerpts.Value: EFFECTS UPON STRATUM CORNEUM WERE STUDIED BY MEANS OF KERATIN DENATURATION & EXTRACTION OF PROTEINS & AMINO ACIDS. PERCUTANEOUS ABSORPTION OF LABELED SURFACTANTS BY GUINEA PIGS IN VIVO WAS STUDIED. SODIUM LAURYL ETHER SULFATE HAD LOWER PENETRABILITIES.

non_human_toxicity_excerpts.References: SERRANO JJ ET AL; PARFUMS, COSMET, AROMES 13, 55 (1977)
non_human_toxicity_excerpts.Value: ANIONIC & AMPHOLYTIC SURFACTANTS USED IN SHAMPOO FORMULATIONS WERE EXAMINED FOR EYE IRRITATING ACTIVITY IN RABBITS. AMPHOLYTIC SURFACTANTS PRODUCED SEVERE EYE IRRITATION, @ 2.5 & 5.0%. EYE IRRITATION WAS OBSERVED WITH LAURYL ETHER SULFATES ONLY @ 20% CONCN.

non_human_toxicity_excerpts.References: HOPKIN R, KAIN JM; THE EFFECTS OF SOME POLLUTANTS ON THE SURVIVAL, GROWTH AND RESPIRATION OF LAMINARIA HYPERBOREA; ESTUARINE COASTAL MAR SCI 7(6) 531 (1978)
non_human_toxicity_excerpts.Value: EFFECTS OF DETERGENTS WERE MEASURED IN LAB BY CULTURING YOUNG STAGES & MEASURING RESPIRATION RATES OF DISCS OF MATURE FROND TISSUE OF LAMINARIA HYPERBOREA. IN CULTURE, SURVIVAL OF GERMINATING GAMETOPHYTES WAS REDUCED WITH TOXIC CONCN OF 10 MG/CU OF SODIUM LAURYL ETHER SULFATE.
